intro: Endostemon stenocaulis, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed endostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in coastal or sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
